thread.title: Jools Oliver launches 'My Rainbow Baby' Mothercare bodysuits
thread.title_full: Jools Oliver launches 'My Rainbow Baby' Mothercare bodysuits

author: Emma Gill
title: Jools Oliver launches 'My Rainbow Baby' Mothercare bodysuits
text:
Jools Oliver launches 'My Rainbow Baby' Mothercare bodysuits A donation from each sale will go to miscarriage research charity Tommy's Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Jools Oliver launches rainbow baby vest Share this video Get What's On   Thank you for subscribing!   
Jools Oliver is launching a 'Rainbow Baby' bodysuit to help fund research into miscarriages, premature births and stillbirths. 
A rainbow baby is a baby born following a miscarriage or still birth - the idea that a storm is followed by a beautiful bright rainbow, giving hope to families of things getting better. 
Now chef Jamie Oliver's wife Jools has created a vest within her Little Bird collection, which will hit the shelves in Mothercare next week. 
A £1 donation from the sale of each bodysuit will go to Tommy’s, the leading charity funding research into pregnancy problems that lead to miscarriage, premature birth and stillbirth. Jools Oliver with the vests Read More Jamie Oliver's wife Jools reveals name of baby boy with teasing Instagram post 
Jools, who gave birth to the couple's fifth child, son River Rocket, last August, said: "I’m so proud to be launching this gorgeous Little Bird, My Rainbow Baby Bodysuit. 
"Tragically one in four women loses a baby during pregnancy or birth and when that happens it changes the lives of so many families. 
"Tommy’s funds much needed research into pregnancy problems and provides important pregnancy health information to parents. It’s a wonderful organisation and I am so happy we are able to work together." The My Rainbow Baby bodysuit Read More Business rockets for Clara and Macy after Jamie and Jools Oliver announce baby name 
The short sleeve cream bodysuit, with signature Little Bird piping on the neck, legs and sleeves, features a bright rainbow print on the front as well as the wording ‘My Rainbow Baby’. 
It will be available from February 16, in sizes newborn to nine months, and retailing at £8. Stock will be sold at 47 stores, including the Mothercare at Manchester Fort and online at www.mothercare.com . 
For details about the charity visit www.tommys.org . A £1 donation from the sale of each bodysuit will go to Tommy’s Read More
